description:
This place is slowly becoming my favorite lunch spot in the hood.

I work nearby and recently switched to a paleo diet and this place is perfect for my new dietary needs. All of their soups are amazing and so flavorful and vegan! Today I got the butternut squash soup and it was delicious, and I'm not even a big fan of butternut squash! I usually pair one of their soups with a side of their chicken and almond salad and it's the perfect lunch.

The staff is always extremely friendly and I love the chocolate samples they have throughout the store. Just found out they have a loyalty card and once you fill it up, you get $10 off so make sure you grab one!
author: Taylor B.

description:
Vegan here. I was in town for a conference and came to this place for lunch three days in a row. Every time they got the food out fast and were generally friendly and helpful.

I had the quinoa burger, tempeh burger and curry tofu wrap. Each was good, small-ish but dense and not too expensive. Of those three my favorite was the tempeh burger.
author: Ben M.

description:
One day in the afternoon my glycemic was a little bit down, I was near this store and I have taken a muffin it was really good and I also like how the store is. Staff is polite and helpful. 
They are sensitive to ecology.
I have ordered today a quiche it was very good. (Around 7$)
author: Marie-Claire L.

description: Came here to pick up my vegan quinoa burger on mealpal and I was pleasantly surprised. The burger is on the smaller side but once you have your first bite you realize it's dense and very filling. Freshly made with good quality ingredients and freshly roasted this is a good and healthy lunch option along with many of the other dishes this cafe have.
author: Ruchi M.

description: If you're vegan and work in San Francisco financial district, this place have vegan options. Such as vegan quinoa burger , vegan wrap etc. their ingredients are locally sourced and organic.
author: Madhu J.

description:
I made a quick stop at Newtree to grab the Quinoa burger for lunch and was a little disappointed at the size of the burger that I was handed. It was literally as thin as a cheese slice kept between two slices of bread (check out the attached picture). 

All that doubt and disappointment was laid to rest when I actually took a bite of the burger. Although it was a little dry, this was probably the best quinoa burger that I've ever had and tasted a lot better than I had imagined. It only comes with a quinoa patty and one piece of radish inside but ended up working perfectly for lunch. 

4 stars for the taste but they can probably do a lot better in terms of the quantity and ingredients in the burger.
author: Gaurav K.

description: Amazing coffee place serving delicious freshly-made vegan pastries. Very welcoming staff and cute decorations! Perfect spot for a quick break off work since it's ideally located in the heart of financial district. A must go!!
author: Fanny L.

description:
This place is better than freakin Ghirardelli. Hidden in a little alley near a pilates studio, Newtree is truly a hidden gem. Let's be real, anywhere with its own brand of chocolate and samples immediately wins my adoration. 

Thus, I've walked past Newtree, and I've been dying to try this place forever (since the first time I walked past). Today was that day!

Why it's amazing:
- Newtree has its own brand of chocolate. And it is yummy! We sampled their hot cocoa which is like drinking chocolate. That stuff is rich! And spiced...almost reminds me of Mexican hot cocoa, but not spicy. Plus, I bet they use their own chocolate in the mouth watering-looking cookies. And they have samples of all of their chocolates. 
- They have coffee and drinks.
- Sweet and savory pastries and snacks. 
- Pre-made salads
- Plus a number of indoor and outdoor tables where you can sit

Yes, it is pricey. What's new in the city? Yes, it's good. Yes, 100% rate of return.
author: Libby J.

description:
I tried this Newtree location well before I moved to SF and only tried their hot chocolate (which was too crazy thick for me). However, I moved here last year and since this place is so close to work and offers a variety of vegan options, I gave NewTree another shot and eat here almost every day I go to the office.  The reality here is:

THEY 
MAKE
DELICIOUS
VEGAN
QUINOA
SALAD

No lie, this is my favorite salad in SF. And they've made the vegan quinoa salad larger than in the past...and it's reasonably priced. HOORAY.

Oh and before I forget, here's my review from their California street location (my client was nearby so I ate at this location a lot during that project!):

I've stopped by NewTree for lunch a few times now and really like it. While slightly overpriced, I really like their vegan quinoa salad. You can choose a dressing for the salad (there are two vegan options), but I have found that the quinoa salad is good enough on it's own and I don't use dressing when I eat it--the quinoa is flavored with a cashew and arugula cream. Sometimes NewTree has samples of its food items at the checkout register. Last time I was there I was able to try their vegan burger, which I thought was quite good, but I didn't get it during that visit because I was set on salad that day. I will definitely get the burger next time (if you get it, have them warm it up for you). Overall, this is a cute place with good vegan lunch options. I'll be back.
author: Christina M.

description: On the hunt for a snack in the afternoon and made my way here. The quiche and cookies were great. However totally turned off by the grumpy guy at the counter...did not respond to the smile and answered in monosyllables. Reminded me how overpriced everything was. Please put people like this in a non-customer facing role.
author: Sunil R.

description: I liked the zucchini and kale soup. The tofu wrap also was delicious. The big negative is that the price and quantity of food are disproportionate.
author: Kiran K.

description:
I really like this place!  They offer thoughtful food choices, and there's plenty of room to chill if you have time to eat.

They know how to make real espresso macchiatos!  And their matcha tea was good.

I usually grab a Breakfast Burrito (with or without bacon) as it's the best option for this area imo.
author: John M.

description: Ordered a breakfast sandwich for lunch.  It was tasty and had a good balance of eggs and veggies. Staff were great.  Coffee was sub par especially with all the other great cafes nearby.
author: Erika R.

description: I found the staff to be extremely rude. I frequent this place cause it's convenient to buy food that's ready to eat.
author: Kissy F.

description:
I'll start with the customer service - both times I've been the customer service was really good. The staff is friendly and helpful and quick to answer questions. Also the decor is really cool - the cafe is super cute and it's easy to navigate. 

My first visit I had a cafe au lait, it was hot, fast and fresh. But the coffee really just didn't taste very good. I was disappointed, BUT I figured it's not their fault I didn't like the taste good to ME.

My second visit I wanted a pastry - so I ordered an oatmeal chocolate chip cookie. The cashier looked at the cookie closely and said out loud "there's no chocolate chips in here." He then turns the cookie over searching for a chocolate chip and says "oh -there's the chocolate." That's a bit weird, but fresh baked goods typically don't all look the same. I then asked for a plain chocolate chip cookie to take home. I was rung up and the two cookies came to almost $7.00!!! I put the chocolate chip cookie back and just paid for the oatmeal chocolate chip. 

I leave and take a bit out of my cookie, and go to look for the chocolate - I find the One chocolate chip in the entire cookie...and it's a raisin. No big deal - but for $3.30 I'm taking it back and getting the cookie I ordered. I took the cookie back, and was helped immediately. The other cashier looks at the cookie with me, breaks it apart and declares "all of these are oatmeal raisin." The original cashier then realized the cookies are labeled wrong and finds the oatmeal chocolate chip cookie. And we exchange cookies and I leave on my way. 

Unfortunately - the cookie was drier than saw dust and tasted like dry oatmeal. The cookie felt soft in my hand, but the mouthfeel was closer to sand than cookie. I promptly disposed of my $3.30 cookie and was immediately upset that I paid that much for a cookie that really shouldn't be referred to as a pastry as much as a clump of sawdust and flavorless chocolate. 

But as I said - the shining start is the awesome customer service - maybe I'm  just not ordering the right things, but it's not likely I'll return to find out if that's the case.
author: Christina B.

description: Cute place and really nice staff. Bathroom for customers. Low key but central location and good ambiance. Perky vibe yet lighting isn't bright which is great when you're tired in the morning and trying to ease into your day
author: Samantha C.

description:
Vegan, gluten-free, organic, artisanal, dairy-free, whole-wheat, kale, quinoa, superfood. Well, those would be the key buzzwords you'd look for in a cafe if you live a super health-conscious lifestyle. NewTree certainly looks trendy enough.The space is small, but feels pretty spacious with high ceilings and a couple of couches in the corner. The tall, over-arching bamboo-stick-looking-things are interesting to look at, but I couldn't help but wonder who has the unfortunate job of cleaning them. 
I enjoy vegetables, but I am not one to pay $10 for a salad or a meatless sandwich, so I had decided this cafe probably wasn't for me. I prefer to make my own salads.

Then I noticed that NewTree is also a chocolate shop. There were about a dozen different flavors of very neatly arranged chocolate bars on a large set of shelves. Besides chocolate, they also sell Belgian waffles, spreads, and other snack things. 
I grabbed a chocolate bar off the shelf and turned it over to look at the Nutrition Facts. My eyebrows raised when I noticed that most of these bars have about 9 grams of dietary fiber per serving, and each bar is 2 servings, so that's 18 grams of fiber per chocolate bar! Each bar has a little less than 400 calories. That's pretty damn good compared to a Fiber One Bar, but at about $7 per bar, they will cost you a pretty penny. 

I was getting ready for a trip to the motherland and I wasn't sure what gifts to bring the relatives from the good 'ol U.S. of A. But I knew my grandpa loved chocolate and he needed fiber. So I chose a whole bunch of flavors, some typical - milk chocolate, almonds, dark chocolate, some not so typical - Belgian biscuit, ginger, quinoa flax. They also provide samples in little glass containers with tongs. They tasted sweet, rich, and creamy, with hardly a hint of fibrous texture. I spent so much money that they told me I 'earned' a free mini bar, so I chose the milk chocolate. The lady helping me was super sweet and friendly.

After that initial purchase, I decided to give NewTree a real try. Other than salads and vegetarian sandwiches, they do have a couple of meat options, as well as baked goods. I decided to try a quiche. I wanted the Sweet Potato & Bacon, but they were out, so I settled on the Tomato & Goat Cheese Quiche. The crust was okay. The filling was a little too tart for me. Since goat cheese and tomato are both tart, it could have used a more savory component. I was mainly disappointed that it wasn't heated up. I wasn't expecting to receive a cold quiche, nor did the cashier ask if I would like it warmed up. My $6 quiche didn't fill me up either. 

I doubt I'd return for a meal, but maybe... just maybe I might stop by for pastry and a hot chocolate. I only tried one thing from the menu, and I'd give the quiche about a 5/10, but the chocolate bars are more like an 8/10. They also sell gift sets and things of that nature, so at least NewTree is a convenient place to pick up a last minute gift.
author: Joy W.

description:
This place is really cute and a good place to come to work or escape the hustle and bustle. I came in for lunch to get the Sunrise Roll but they didn't have that and asked me if I was looking for something vegan. I replied in the affirmative and they suggested the curried tofu wrap. I really enjoyed the wrap they used (whole-wheat tortilla) but the flavors of the tofu wrap were just okay to me. It didn't really stand out. I also got a matcha latte which did not have a lot of matcha flavor. I opted for the almond milk pairing and it tasted more like straight almond milk than a matcha latte. 

This place has a lot of potential if it could work on some of their flavor profiles and probably lower the prices just a bit. Even within FiDi, I find this to be on the pricier side and not necessarily worth it.
author: Joan S.

description: I love the place, good food, good coffee and very nice staff, I recommend it for a rich and healthy breakfast burn
author: Milton M.

description: had a really great latte from this shop while I was in SF for vacation. they were super friendly also!
author: Tray B.

description: Yummy chai. Yummy lattes. Their staff is very versatile when you want to get extra creative with your order.
author: Yad L.

description:
Many pre-made lunch options that are gluten free and vegan - salads, sandwiches and daily soups. 

$11.50 pre-tax for the chicken salad w/avocado - enjoyed the tomato-based dressing, fresh greens, sprouts and broccoli with the big serving of chicken breast and avocado. 

Ample space to sit, lots of desserts like fruit, as well as pastries like gluten free and vegan cookies: chocolate chip, mexican mocha, ginger, and more!
author: Kristie C.

description: Quick Mealpal review: I just tried Newtree for the first time today via Mealpal and they have now earned a top spot in my weekly meal rotation. I was worried the half Caprese sandwich would be too small for my hungry hippo appetite, but nah. It wasn't. With the big, warm cup of delicious vegan potato/coconut soup (with mushroom??), the whole meal filled me up to that perfect level of being satisfied but not falling asleep over my keyboard from post-lunch food coma. And the sandwich, with its warm, melty, gooey cheese felt surprisingly heavy, so I was happy to only have half. I was pleased to see them throw the sandwich fresh onto the panini press after I arrived, so that it would be warm and toasty by the time I got it into my mouth. I know Mealpal is supposed to be "ready when you arrive", but the five minute wait was totally worth getting a fresh warm sando. 5 out of 5, will nom again. (And again, and again, and again...)
author: Amanda C.

description:
Being lactose-intolerant, it's hard to find creamy soups that don't have dairy in them. This is where NewTree comes in. I've come here for their coffee (their almond milk is LIT), and salads to-go but my coworkers turned me on to their soups when I complained I cannot find a good butternut squash soup without dairy in it. Their soups change daily and sell out before 12:30! So get there early in order to try the soup. You can do a taster of it before deciding on the size you want or you might not like it at all. I've had tomato bisque made with almond, asparagus soup, and many others that after consuming I don't feel bloated or sick!

They also have a ton of chocolates and a chocolate drink that I haven't tried yet but hear nothing but good things about!
author: Constance D.

description:
Some days are on like Donkey Kong; others are Diddy.
This is that smaller version. #thatswhatshesaid
Don't tell anyone I ate a healthy lunch.
I swear I'm just here for the beach jungle ambience.
author: Dan B.

description:
Really tasty baked goods.  The coconut macaroons are awesome.

The drinks are just not very good though.  I've gotten a few things and none have been good.  They either have no taste or are simply undrinkable.

Matcha latte? Tasteless.  Cappucino?  Tasteless.  Latte with almond milk?  Nasty.  I took one sip and was completely disgusted.  I took another sip to convince myself it actually was that bad, then I tossed it into the compost.
author: Jason F.

description:
Had a caprese sandwich here via mealpass. They supposedly warmed it up for me but I couldn't tell.

The sandwich was kind of terrible. There were almost no tomatoes in it so it was just cheese and arugula. The 1 slice of tomato in it was very thin, soggy, and slightly sour...

The thing that bothered me the most though was their bread. I believe they used a sour dough baguette which is fine... But the sandwich fillings were so light in flavor (not enough pesto/seasoning) that the sourness of the bread completely overwhelmed everything. The baguette texture was also disappointing. The crust is more rubbery than crunchy.

I definitely recommend against getting the caprese sandwich here.
author: Lily L.

description:
I've had a small selection of lunch options from here over the years. Their soups are always really good and I love that they are often dairy free. Their wraps are okay... Nothing special. Quiches are good but I prefer Cafe Madeleine's. Their baked goods are good too. Muffins are moist and tasty. 

But they really need to label their baked goods. 

I asked what kind of muffin was in the glass jar on the counter. The cashier said it was walnut, as there was a walnut decorating the top of it. Only one of the jars of cookies was labeled. After I hmm'ed and haww'ed and tried to order something else, the more experienced barista in the back explained the zucchini muffins on the counter were the only muffins left.

Oh so they were zucchini muffins, not walnut muffins.

Dirty chai was hella spicy and is unsweetened by default, I think. It was unexpected. I prefer The Chai Cart. (I know they don't do dirty chais but their regular chai would have really hit the spot) 

Was surprised they don't have coconut milk considering their plant-based vegan-friendly concept. 

Service is usually friendly. It was exceptionally nice today.
author: L Y.

description: I ordered vegetation quinoa burger. I booked it on meal pal. The buffet and very strongly of meat. I'm a strict vegetation and do not eat egg. The burger was disgusting. If you are a vegetarian do NOT enter this place. They probably use the same oil or vessels to cook meat  and vegetables. Disgusting.
author: Akshay J.

description:
Friendly service, yummy snacks and coffee, with a cool lounge and outdoor seating area. I met a friend here and had a "decaf coffee" - in reality, a decaf Americano, but they charged me for a coffee. Thank you! 

I sat outside where they put out some little green tables in the brick Ecker walkway / alleyway. I also had a fruity granola bar - yummy. The one big negative (not cafes fault) was all the construction. The saws, drills and hammers got old. Thankfully they shut down work and my friend and I had a very pleasant chat, enjoyed our Americanos and the ambiance. 

I'd definitely return.
author: David S.

description:
I Love this place for lunch. Great service. They have a few outdoor tables where each table can fit 2-3 people. Great for vegetarians.

They have soups, salads, sandwiches etc. They usually have a vegetarian soup on a daily basis. 

Their salads are small or large size so you can do small salad and soup. However, sandwiches are always in one size; you can't do half.

1. Red Lentil Soup (loved it!)
2. Goat Cheese sandwich with Nuts (this was okay, a bit too sweet for my taste)
3. Tomato Bisque soup (it's okay, not the most delicious)
4. Quinoa burger (pretty good)
5. Zucchini Coconut Soup (absolutely yummy!)
6. Caprese on Baguette (good but not great. Lacks a bit of salt)
author: Hiral P.

description: Discovering this place a few days after watching What The Health was a godsend.  They have an amazing variety of vegan soups pretty much every single day!  I've tried 3 so far, and they have all been delicious.  My favorite is their vegan tomato bisque! Hope they keep up this awesome selection and quality.
author: Evelyn T.

description: Tried Vegan Hot Chocolate and it's absolutely great! Haven't drunk such smooth and dense hot chocolate for a long time and this is way better than those made from instant powder.
author: Ares O.

description:
Well, I am not really a fan (according to yelp 4 start is Yay! I am a fan)! But I have been to this place twice in a month so I will give it a 4 star.

Three reasons why this place gets 4 star from me - 
1. Healthy food: Its the same soup, bland salad and wraps. But, The food is really healthy (writing this while eating my kettle chips!) so if you are looking to eat some healthy and yummy wrap/salad, this is your place!

2. Plenty of vegan/vegetarian options - including cookies and chocolates.

3. Less queue: Today, I went here at noon and any place in FiDi takes a loooooong time/queue to get your turn. I dint had to wait for my turn here but my order was late by 10 mins (without any queue)!

I like the fact that it is so close to my work but I find them a little spicy for just a soup and Bland salad.
author: Pratibha S.

description:
Beautiful place for coffee at middle of the day! Grub my Americano and amazing "Granola square" in a "New tree",that on 1Ecker Pl. Fhe taste a coffee was good and barista added steam little bit steam milk ,as I like:) But this Granola square was really delicious- everybody must to try it!!!Cuz it's not just a oats,seeds ,nuts -u will find some secret Thanks,girl from Chicago,who works in this small but pretty cozy place-she is so friendly,smiley :) 
I recommend this place 
And also you can come inside and try real Belgium chocolate:)
author: Olha I.

description: Great little cafe for healthy lunch options. This was my go to lunch spot while I was doing whole 30. Their vegan soup of the day is always tasty and I enjoy their small sides and salads.
author: Sam L.

description: I've passed by this spot so many times for the last year and the other day I decided to come in. Staff was ok a new girl helped me out and needed a little help. I ordered the Belgium mocha which wasn't too bad actually! It was very strong and got me going. I ordered their brownie though and it was absolutely terrible. I know this is a more "earthy" spot, so a lot of food is vegan friendly, so I don't know why I was so shocked. It's a nice little quiet spot located right behind my work too which is nice. It was very pricey though the Mocha and the brownie came out to almost $10 bucks! Probably will come back for the drink!
author: James R.

description: I've worked in 3 offices within a few blocks of here for 2 years so I have been here many times. I tend to mix up what I order. Great muffins and the oatmeal bar is a fabulously rich breakfast. You order plain oatmeal then have a variety of toppings to make it your perfect cup of breakfast. Sandwiches at lunch are hit or miss. The hot chocolate is out of this world amazing. The chai tea, though, is not good. The last 2 times I've ordered it, it takes more like warm water than chai. Super disappointing.
author: Jaclyn K.

description:
Man, I sure am crazy for walking by this place so many times and never going in. 

It's located in this cozy little alley by Yank Sing and this fancy work out place for pregnant ladies. I like that it's so close to work and other FiDi/SOMA stuff but also tucked away - it allows them to have a nice little seating area outside.

The interior is spacious and the decor is cool in a sort of fresh, modern-looking way, if that makes any sense.  They have a huge wall of chocolate bars with free samples. They also usually have free samples of their delicious pastries. 

In terms of what I've eaten there, the chicken salad and deviled eggs were both delicious. I'm also a fan of their chocolate chip coconut cookies and signature brownies. They make amazing hot chocolate that's actually dairy-free and made with almond milk, and their lattes are pretty good also. Prices are about what you would expect for healthy food in San Francisco. Some people might think it's too high, but I don't think it's outside of the realm of normality.

NewTree has a nice selection of gluten free and vegan items, too. 

Really a great little spot in the area!
author: Tay H.

description:
Cute spot with high prices, especially so considering what you actually get in return.
This would be fine if the portions were decent and/or the flavor was outstanding.
No on both counts.
Got a small salad (chicken and avocado), for $11.50 - bland flavor and avocado that was turning brown. If I hadn't paid for this salad, I'd not have finished it.

Given the myriad local dining options, I won't likely stop by New Tree again, and would advise avoiding.
author: Ethan R.

description:
I loved Newtree and some of the food items offered. I also love the atmosphere and the fact that it is hidden in an alley, away from all the busy comings and goings in FiDi. 

However, my friend and I have both noticed a price hike in the past few months. Specifically, the granola square used to be around $2, now it's $3.30. 

I used to go to Newtree around 2-3 times a wk, now..haven't gone back since the new price increase and will probably go back only once in a while when I need the space and quiet during breakfast/lunch. 

Don't be ridiculous with your prices please!! There are many cheap and good options around.
author: Shelly L.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite lunch spots. I was obsessed with their curried tofu wrap and their granola squares. They not only raised their prices but they also seemed to have changed their portion size and their recipe. 

I got their curried tofu wrap and had to toss the other half because it tasted more like a mayo tofu wrap. Unfortunately, I will no longer be going to New Tree.
author: Elim K.

description: Came to this by chance; I had a client meeting nearby. Exceptional cappuccino. Calling it just a neighborhood gem is actually a disservice. Kudos to whoever roasted those coffee beans.
author: Sujata D.

description:
I recently I popped into this place when I was searching for vegan snacks near by to my office. To my surprise, New Tree not only had several vegan cookies but also a lot of well-labeled vegan lunch options.

I made a point to come back for lunch later in the week, trying the quinoa burger and daily soup. Though it seemed a bit pricey, I'm sure their rent is very expensive and the portions were quite sizeable and very filling. My daily soup was a zucchini base and was nearly enough in and of itself. The quinoa burger was on a delicious acme bun with hummus and other fixings. Wash it all down some of their iced green tea and I was feeling pretty great.

So glad this place exists in Fidi and will definitely be coming back soon.
author: Jon T.

description:
The great customer service and music moved my review from a solid 4 stars to a 5 star review.

Things I liked:

-Affordable vegan sandwiches (around $7)
-They sold interesting chocolate bars (like one with Thyme in it!) and they had free samples so you could taste them before you committed to a whole bar.
-I liked the emphasis on organic and fair trade ingredients, and the vegan labeling.
author: Stuart F.

description:
The chocolate and service were wonderful.  I discovered this small S.F. gem hidden in an alley between Mission and Market.  Their signature drink is a hot chocolate made with almond milk, cinnamon, orange peel, and several other fun additions.  They let me sample the hot chocolate, but I'm not a fan of the orange peel taste, so I decided on the lavender latte.  It was good, but I'm getting the mocha next time.  I sampled some of their chocolates, including a chocolate tart, and soon realized you can't go wrong with anything chocolate here!  

In addition to coffee, they have an eclectic selection of chocolates, including some with thyme and chili pepper.  

This is a fun little shop with excellent service that will definitely satisfy your sweet tooth. (Written on July 2013)

Update (July 2013): I had the mocha--it includes their hot chocolate.  If you like the hot chocolate, you'll probably like their mocha.

Update (August 2013): their Chai Latte is delicious!
author: Matt R.

description:
Cool place to buy local chocolates. I was semi-disappointed that they only served pre-made salads and sandwiches here, but overall the ingredients are good and the food is relatively fresh. It was probably made the morning of the same day. There's usually a long line for lunch, but it moves quickly since people are just grabbing and going. It's a quick and healthy choice for the working crowd. 

Plus, you can get your chocolate fix at the same time and the place has a very modern and trendy feel to it. There's quite a bit of seating inside, so after you order, you can sit indoors to enjoy.
author: Audrey L.

description:
I'm not fully committed to chocolate. Let's say I prefer to flirt with it. A chocolate dilettante, if you will. But there comes a time when I suddenly find myself fiending for cacao bean goodness and once that soul-shattering chocogasm is achieved, you'll find me professing my undying devotion. Why hello, NewTree Cafe. How *you* doin'?

I was perusing reviews for a decent cafe in the area with wifi and NewTree popped up. Left to my own devices, I probably would have ignored a place that is best know for its hot chocolate (I can't even remember the last time I drank it), but when I read the seductive reviews of several yelpers who mentioned a spicy vegan variety, the fiending cameth upon me.

Lust at first sip, baby. The really nice gal behind the counter suggested I taste it before going head first into an entire cup, being that some people find it too spicy (wusses!) Amigos, it's pure manna from heaven! You will think it's made with cream, that's how rich it is, but instead, it's made with almond milk. I bought a cup and sat on one of the couches in the back corner and a perfectly sultry afternoon was had, even though I was technically working(they have available outlets and free wifi). 

I also bought a sandwich to go, as I had a flight to catch and I wanted to avoid airport food at all costs. I had a veg sandwich with shaved parm on ciabatta. I could have done with less ciabatta and more veggies, but the mole spread on top (more chocolate!) made this more of a artisanal affair. 

Oh and be sure to glance up at the ceiling. That is some cool design!
author: Joi B.

description: Decent vegan options. Vegan hot chocolate has a ton of caffeine, you will be wired for a while.
author: Ben L.

description:
I have enjoyed coming here for lunch numerous times and had the Quinoa burger.  A very enjoyable and healthy lunch option that is served up by some very nice people.

The chocolate on the other hand is pretty "meh."  I sampled a number of chocolates and ended up buying the dark bar.  It is very cool that the store allows you to sample so many chocolates.  Brought the bar home, waited a few weeks and when I cracked it open was greeted with a mouthful of disappointment.  Since the bar was stored in a wine fridge it should have kept pretty well, so not sure why the experience was so bad.

Because I enjoyed the quinoa burger so much I am going to give them the benefit
author: Bob F.

description:
SUCH A CUTE SPACE! I DIE! 

The interior decor of this place is so adorable and it revolves around CHOCOLATE. Doesn't get better than that! There are wood panels arranged to look like big trees inside the cafe.  The beams fan out onto the ceiling and the entire ceiling is overlaced with rounded wood beams that look like fans.  They hang little plants from the beams and the whole place is so bright and fun. 

I am so excited that I found this place, as it is tucked off of first street and you wouldn't really notice it if you were far away. 

The chocolate is delicious! 
I am so excited to go back and try the hot chocolate :)
author: Kristin C.

description:
When I take BART into work, I sometimes stop by this cafe since I figured that it was off the main streets and not so busy.  Nope...no such luck but the staff here have very enthusiastic attitudes in the morning when I went and based on the convos that I heard when I was waiting in line, they have a steady diet of regulars who go there all the time.  Of course, when I'm waiting in line, those convos do seem like they drag forever when I need my chai latte or a caffeine jolt in the morning!

I'll still come back here solely for the employee friendliness alone.
author: Ben H L.

description:
Spinach hummus sandwich - delicious blend of sweet savory and sour notes in one bite, toasted warm. Pretty perfect for a veggie wrap. 

Brownie - good, clean tasting, light brownie that slightly crumbles when you pull at it. Not too greasy or oily. I was a bit disappointed - had hoped for a more intense dark chocolate taste but decent nonetheless.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I first discovered New Tree chocolate in Belgium whilst doing my usual foreign grocery store foraging.

Then recently I noticed the New Tree sign on my way to the office one morning but didn't immediately put together that this New Tree was the same I'd known in Europe.

Their Belgian hot chocolate is vegan and made with almond milk, dark chocolate cloves and orange zest. But what you really need to know is it tastes gorgeous. Gorgeous! And it's so rich you may want to share a cup with someone you like a lot. But I must knock off a star because last time I went they were out of it.

Not only is the chocolate continental, their hours are quite European too: sunrise to sunset Monday through Friday.
author: Miriam W.

description:
I don't really get NewTree. Oh, it's a pretty enough place, very green in every way that green can be, but what is it really? A chocolate shop? A cafe? A gift shop? Oh, it's all three. Hmmm. I've actually popped in here a couple of times before, but like a confused hamster in a Habitrail ball, I rolled in, I looked, and then I rolled out again. In fact, they serve food fit for a hamster like their $8.75 Belgian Salad, which is stacked one on top of each other in their mini-fridge. I came in to try one, and it was certainly decent enough with Romaine lettuce and - surprise! - shredded Brussels sprouts and then topped with radishes, dried apricots, almonds, feta cheese bits and mint (see photo).

So here's the thing. No one told me to pick up a little container of the pomegranate chocolate or blueberry lavender vinaigrettes stacked against the side window (see photo). That's probably because the staff was quite indifferent to my experience there. I don't think I received any eye contact, so I just took my bowl and sat at one of their high-top cafe tables to eat my Belgian salad. I was thinking how green everything looked, green and clean like a spa that sells mulch. I was fantasizing how much more interesting the place would have been in a goth-punk motif with a cashier that looked like Lisbeth Salander. But no chance. This is the kind of place that delights skinny women with money.

Can you tell I didn't love it? Yeah, I didn't. The salad seemed overpriced for lunchtime grazing especially since I realized from reading the label on the bowl that I was supposed to get an organic roll as well as the vinaigrette. Good thing I don't need the carbs, but you would have thought someone there could have told me that or at least cared enough to see if I was having a nice dining experience at my lonely stool in the middle of the store. I guess that's what made me feel like a hamster in a Habitrail ball. I just wanted to roll away again. Meanwhile, those skinny women were sampling the chocolates on the shelves dropping the tongs on the floor and putting them back on the shelf. Apparently they were raised by wolves.

FOOD - 3 stars...quality ingredients but overpriced for grazing
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...boring in an airy kind of way
SERVICE - 2 stars...here I am...HERE!
TOTAL - 3 stars...barely 3 stars and really for the sustainability factor, but then again I'm probably not in their target group
author: Ed U.

description:
This review was saved as a draft from last summer (oops!). I'm revisiting it after a dental visit that ties back to this. 

I got an organic vegan buckwheat salad. The salad was overpriced and looked relatively small for the $11.50 price tag ($13.55 with tax and tip) but the ingredients appeared to be high quality. 

Unfortunately I bit into a large pebble which hurt and could have seriously damaged my tooth if I'd bitten down harder.  I went to return the salad and asked for my money back because finding rocks in ones food is completely unacceptable. If they'd taken it back with excellent customer service I would have given 4-5 stars but they gave me an incredibly hard time. First, the woman at the counter thought I was trying to get a free meal and asked to have the pebble to show the owner (gross). She let me know she could offer me something else instead rather than refunding me. I showed her the pebble and said that I really just wanted a refund. She accused me of trying to get my money back after eating the "whole" salad, harping on how it was almost gone and asking when I actually found the pebble (obviously towards the end of the salad!). This implied that she thought I may have found a massive pebble in my salad and continued eating so I could get a free lunch or was making it up. 

The worst part is that I was actually finding little pebbles in the salad while eating and ignoring them because they just didn't wash their grains well enough. Once I chipped (dentist confirmed) my tooth on a big rock I said I'd had enough and wanted a refund. I am not a fan of New Tree.
author: Katie B.

description:
5 stars alone for their Lavender chocolate.  

I discovered NewTree lavender chocolate years ago while shopping at Cost Plus world market and ever since them I have been a dedicated fan.  Cost Plus doesn't sell it anymore and I can't EVER seem to find this chocolate anywhere else. I've tried Whole Foods and various chocolatiers in the area and no such luck! 

I was so happy to discover NewTree Cafe & Chocolate shop on Yelp and bookmarked it for my next lunch date in the financial district.   They not only carried my favorite lavender chocolate bar but also had many different options. 

I finally got to check it out yesterday, April 23rd and it definitely met my expectations.  
They have samples of their different chocolate bars which is great because there are so many you can try.  I settled for my lavender chocolate and had to run out the door but am definitely coming back to try their sandwiches, salads and drinks. 

Cute location and great service.  I can't wait for my next visit and am so happy that i know where to go for my NewTree Lavender chocolates.
author: Christine P.

description: I sat charging my phone, doodling in the guest book, and eating free chocolate samples for 45 minutes without buying anything and baristas never hassled me or told me to leave. V clutch
author: Emily O.

description:
This quaint cafe right next to GGU, Yank Sing, and the building where I work at looks pretty big on the whole organic thing. Organic chocolate, snacks, what have you.

I have came to this place for 3 different drinks on 3 different occasions, and now I can say that out of the latte, the almond mocha, and the Belgian hot chocolate, go for the hot chocolate. It is a little pricier ($5.65 for a 12oz cup), but man oh man, the flavor is so rich! It's a little thicker than I expected, but I'll take that over some water-based ersatz hot chocolate any day, and since it's based off Belgian Dark Chocolate, it's actually bittersweet. The balance between bitter and sweet is maintained pretty well through the duration of this drink. 

If I ever had to come back to this place, it would be just for that drink. Perfect for the upcoming cold days.
author: Viet N.

description: It's awesome! Amazing samples. "Healthy desserts." The best among the chocolates is the black courant - mmmmm. Funny, very SF-ey staff.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I have walked by this place a gazillion times but never bothered to stop in. I decided to give it a try after running into an associated who raved about their food. 

I got the soup/salad combo - fairly reasonable -just under $12. The cauliflower soup was tasty and healthy, and the chicken avocado salad was packed with flavor! 

I would love this place even more if they offered made to order options - I had to carefully pick the pecans out of my salad.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Saw a sign one Friday when I was walking on Market St for NewTree Cafe & Chocolate Shop.  I knew about it, but didn't really know where it was.  It's close to Market across the street from Yank Sing on Ecker Place.

It's only open M-F for Breakfast &  Lunch.  I wish it was open evenings & weekends.

Sandwiches pre-made, pastries made elsewhere & brought it.  I got to sample the hot chocolate - very rich.

Lots of samples of all the candy bars are available.  They have Soft Belgian Chocolate Waffles in a box that's more a cookie than a waffle - looks good on the box, didn't buy.

They sell other stuff too like Mushroom Garden in a box; Grow Bottle to grow your own Parsley in a Wine Bottle.  

I liked the Watermelon iced water they had - help yourself.

Worth a stop to look around &  try some chocolate.
author: Ann L.

description:
I love that I can buy nut free kale chips here.

I love that they have free vegan chocolate samples here (the array of flavors is beautiful as well - such as ginger, cayenne etc.)

I love that they serve up vegan soup here.

I love that they serve up organic salads, which include quinoa, kale, and chicken.

I love that they put an emphasis on healthy and organic.

My quinoa salad was pretty tasty  - as was my soup.

The only thing is that I wasn't necessarily bowled over by their dressings, and though I'm sure that each salad was made fresh that day- the grab and go concept is never quite as appealing as having one made up - just for you. The same love doesn't seem to quite be there.

I think I may still still to Native Juice and Galette 88 for my healthy fix.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: This place is so lovely, but please read up on the correct milk/coffee ratio for cappuccino vs dry cappuccino vs latte etc.   Just because the cup is a big size doesn't mean it should be filled to the brim with moll.
author: Autumn F.

description: Ok so I'm not that into the coffee here but the sandwiches are pretty great so that's why I've pushed my previous rating from 3 to 4. I've had the caprese sandwich here. I don't crave sandwiches, EVER, but I did find myself craving this one today while at work because it is so damn good. There's a pear + brie sandwich on a raisin roll that's very good but sweet. I've put in the recommendation that they swap out the roll since the pear + raisin roll combo just is too sweet. I hope they do it! Oh -- they told me that people have asked for it to be a bigger size too because currently the roll is just slightly smaller than a hamburger bun and just slightly larger than a dinner roll. For almost $7 for a sandwich, yea-- it really could be bigger.
author: Michelle T.

description: NewTree was a lovely little cafe with delicious treats and coffee. The decor and atmosphere were friendly and welcoming, a great place for an afternoon coffee break or meeting with a client. There were pigeons roaming the floor which was a little on the disturbing side but I guess afterall, it is called NewTree!
author: Caroline A.

description:
NewTree used to be amazing - I converted half of my coworkers into fans of their couscous salad when they opened this location. But things have been changing at NewTree and not for the better.

Having given up on the couscous salad since they changed the recipe a few months ago, I tried the new "Belgian Summer" salad - greens, brussels sprouts, almonds, apricots and goat cheese. I have to say, this was the single worst salad I have ever put a fork into. 

Not only were there no greens to be found, but the shredded brussels sprouts were just foul. I love brussels sprouts - they're supposed to have a bitter bite - but these smelled so awful that my office mate asked what the putrid smell was when I cracked open the lid! I don't know if the salad was just past its prime or if this was the intended outcome, but an $11 salad should not be inedible and this one was. 

While the eatery is convenient to my office, I won't be going back. And it seems from the lack of customers in the store at 12:15pm, while every other lunch spot nearby had a line out the door, that the majority of FiDi workers have learned the same lesson.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
My office catered lunch from here, and I was rather disappointed with the sandwiches.

The vegetarian caprese sandwich was dry and not very tasty. The baguette was dry and hard and tasted old.

The Chicken & Salsa Verde sandwich was not very appetizing too. I dont think the spices went well with the chicken. I ended up taking the chicken filling as toppings for the salad and muching on the bread with olive oil :(

The salad was also way over dressed.
author: Christina N.

description:
If you want the best hot chocolate in the city, you go here. Hands down, I have not found better hot chocolate anywhere in SF. Funny enough, it also happens to be vegan, but you'd never know. 

Second up, their quiches, oatmeal bar, and breakfast wraps hit the spot everytime. Like seriously every time. I've had breakfast here 4/5 days a week every week for nearly 4 months. 

I think I might have a NewTree problem =/
author: Nik D.

description: Atmosphere is absolutely stunning. If you order anything that has milk in it like a latte, they tend to go heavy on the milk and not enough of the coffee. The cafe is also a lot smaller than it seems in the pictures. Most people seemed to just stop by for the drink anyways, but don't expect much comfortable sitting room.
author: Peter P.

description:
Signature save.

Thanks to their outstanding and full of flavor signature quinoa zucchini burger topped with curried hummus, greens, tomato and grilled on an Acme bun.

Thanks to their delicious and thick signature hot chocolate made from almond milk.

Thanks to their rich and indulgent signature chocolate and walnut brownie.

Everything was a reasonable $4 - $8. Just another reason all signs point to four stars.

Second location didn't fare as well: http://www.yelp.com/biz/newtree-cafe-and-chocolate-shop-san-francisco-3?hrid=dvcLGkP4tvCFG8fJypeoMQ
author: Jason B.

description:
I kind of love this place. Even though the actual lunch fare kind of sucks. 

Things to love:
- Friendly staff
- FREE samples of every chocolate they sell. Try the thyme (one of my favorite herbs), almond, cinnamon and lime granola chocolates especially
- FREE samples of their soup of the day and hot chocolate
- Gorgeous, funky interior with a soaring Art Nouveau-esque wooden ceiling structure (think Galadriel's palace in Lothlorien from Lord of the Rings--and if you haven't seen LOTR, you have no business existing on this planet), cheery lime-green colors, bar tables and loungey cushioned seats, and plenty of natural light

Things I didn't love:
- The soup du jour: It was some hippie, vegan concoction of carrots mushed with ginger mushed with the essence of Mother Nature's children or something, and tasted terrible
- The North African chicken sandwich: What about this was North African? The lack of spices? The purple lettuce? The faux chicken? At least they grilled it up nice and crisp for free
- The hot chocolate: To quote Homer Simpson, "In theory, communism works. In theory." In theory, hot chocolate made of chocolate, almond milk, orange and cloves sounds exotic and exciting. In execution, it's a thick, brown sludge with slight citrus undertones and enough eau des cloves to make you never want cloves again
- The lack of hooks under the bar tables: Where the hell am I supposed to put my jacket, scarf and purse? On the chocolate bars?

All that said, I'm sure I'll be back. Free Belgian chocolate is just way too good to pass up.
author: Josephine L.

description:
I came here to sit down with a friend to chat and it was eerily quiet which i suppose isi better than loud and chaotic.

Ordered a Latte and a Almond Hot Chocolate. Latte was alright. The coffee isn't overly fragrant but still better than Starbucks and the hot chocolate was just too rich and tasted a little weird. Maybe just not for me because i shared one with my partner and we both got sick.
author: Evelyn W.

description:
OK, they've won me back over. 

For the most part, they've got their vegan game down now.  Lots of vegan soup and salad options (though I still won't try that Pumpkin Ginger soup again), but not only that, they've added some delicious new additions to the soup and sandwich menus. 

Oh, and I didn't mention the hot chocolate?  It's SUPER BOMB.  Melted down dark chocolate with almond milk and spices.  It's really just too yummy for a big old cup.  So I just take it, sip it, savor it, let it last.

The last thing I will say is that everything is a bit on the pricy side.  If you're looking for something on the cheap, this isn't really the place.

But if you're looking for a quick downtown option for delicious healthy eats, then here yo go.
author: Angella S.

description:
This is the third time I've visited NewTree cafe, and I really am impressed. I have not been disappointed with any of the food items or drinks I've ordered. First time I came in, I had no idea what kind of a cafe it was. I just needed something healthy to eat because I was starving. I had never had a vegetarian/vegan dish before so this was all new to me. But I said, why not... The hummus sandwich was really tasty and I didn't care that there was no meat. lol.. Second time, I got the chicken sandwich and a cup of the squash ginger soup. Did not disappoint either. Today, I finally got there early enough to get a quinoa flax salad and a cup of soup. The salad was much tastier than I imagined. And the soup - coconut milk and red bell peppers - is soooo effing good! 
Definitely going to be a regular customer here.. If my budget allows for it.
I think I might try the pastries next :)
author: Audris K.

description:
Came back here after remembering that I liked the quinoa salad, but the salad this time around really disappointed. I can't remember the exact name of it, but it had brussel sprouts, romaine lettuce, nectarines, red cabbage, etc. The flavors didn't really meld together all that well, and there is just something about getting salads made to order rather than pre-packaged into a small refrigerator to pick up. 

However, I also got a chocolate torte, and it made up for everything else. It was very rich and delicious, perfect with coffee or tea, and super decadent. I think I would come back to this place just to try out their desserts and maybe hot chocolate, but the food is not worth it. 

My friend tried out a wrap and a soup, and wasn't really impressed by either of them, so I would skip out on the food here.
author: Annie S.

description:
BEST vegan hot chocolate/vegan mocha you'll ever have. It's ridiculously chocolately, rich, and creamy. If you're craving hot chocolate in this area definitely stop by. They also have an extensive selection of toppings too including marshmallows, cinnamon, cocoa powder, and chocolate sprinkles. 

They also have chocolate samples along the wall that are fun to taste as you wait for your order. Another nice touch to the cafe is the infused water. When I went today, it was mint and orange. 

For lunch I have only tried the chicken salad. While it was pricey for the amount, there was a generous amount of chicken and other ingredients besides plain leaves. 

The regular latte leaves something to be desired, especially when compared to other nearby coffeshops. Get the hot chocolate instead! Haha 

Prices are slightly higher than average in an already pricey part of the city, but the ingredients are fresh and organic so it's well worth the occasional splurge.
author: Kailin L.

description:
Wonderful and friendly staff, great food and great coffee. 
I tend to pick meals that include some kind of meat but I have to say that I am big fan of their couscous salad, as well as the breakfast wrap and soups!! All their other items look delicious also.

And ... can't forget to mention their oatmeal for a good breakfast with a great oatmeal condiment bar, including their tasty chocolate and all kinds of good stuff! 

Highly recommend this as a breakfast, coffee and lunch spot!
author: Chris L.

description:
Yesterday, I asked for a coffee and look what happened:
There were only two customer service representatives, one of them taking orders and the other was making the orders. They took my order and receive a customer after me, made her coffee first which caused me to wait for an extra time. I said okay no problem, it happens, we all are humans. BUT after I received my coffee it was the worst ever test. I don't if they were out of materials or what but I have been buying my coffee from the same store for over a year now and this coffee just made my day worse. I did not complaint on the spot as I was running late, I rather wanted to write it here.  I think, I should change my route in order to buy my coffee somewhere else.
author: Ihsanullah S.

description:
Working just a block away and not wanting to walk farther to my tried and true spots, I decided to finally give New Tree Cafe a shot. No. Mistake. I really should stop being so lazy on warm summer days.

I grabbed the Mediterranean Salad and Organic Chai Latte for $14. The salad was extremely salty and the latte was underwhelming. I guess at the end of the day, they're probably only good for their chocolates since they're a chocolate shop (which I've never tried). But honestly, with that experience, I don't think I'll go back.

I didn't come here for the past 3 years that I've worked just steps away, I'm OK staying away.
author: Cookie M.

description: Pretty much a dud of a place. Service was not good. Seemed like management hired the bottom of the barrel. I received a grunt after waiting a few minutes while the 3 employees bumbled about. By the looks of it, they need money there, so customers should be top priority. Now lets get to the food. I had a sandwich with cheese and arugula for $8.55- subpar. The chocolate was OK, 2 stars for the free samples and atmosphere. Minus 3 for inattentive service and a subpar sandwich. Perhaps the other food is good, but they didn't win me over to try again.
author: S. G.

description:
A great find in an off street behind a 30 floor building on Market. 

Getting the hot chocolate means drinking a bar or two, be warned! It's great stuff, and for the serious chocolate, this is the Grey Goose of chocolate beverages. Thinned with Almond milk, not to sweet. 

Wish they were open later and had more gluten free goodies. Great place to grab a chocolatey snack or a little gift for someone special.
author: Ron G.

description:
Super friendly staff! Young man at register was very patient with introducing their menu items -slow afternoon so no, I didn't keep people waiting ;)

Soup of the day -puréed Split Pea (Excellent)

Almond Hot Chocolate was amazingly delish -I'm extremely picky about my chocolate & this was a treat. Some on Yelp have called this Mexican hot chocolate but it's really Belgian hot chocolate that's spiced with nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves. Not as much cinnamon as in Mexican version -in case you're used to that. 

Side Note: Cheese platter & wine available from 3pm to 6pm. :)

What a nice surprise to stumble upon this place while walking by. Totally casual and unpretentious. Just wholesome food and excellent chocolates!
author: Sabi M.

description:
Hot drip coffee always luke-warm. 
Ice Coffee? Naw, they just pour it in a hot coffee cup and put a hot coffee lid on top and tell you to figure it out. You guys gotta get on your ice coffee plastic cup with lid game. 
Otherwise, the food is somewhat decent if you're looking for something healthy.
Staff seem like dummies kinda
author: Alex A.

description:
Poor service. Staff poorly trained. Inefficient and gives wrong change - in their favor - constantly. 

This used to be my must stop every morning but no longer. The new employees are nowhere near competent.
author: W C.

description: They have all kinda of chocolates here. Cinamon almond chrerry lavender even chili paper ;) if you like to try different things you will like it!
author: Seda G.

description: Some times you just need a moment away from the office. A moment of peace and quiet. A reminder that life exists outside of work. NewTree is that nice 10 minute break, where you can break away from the hustle and bustle of the financial district  It has that comfy yet slightly untidy feel and the baristas are always super friendly and eager to please. Plus their dirty chai just somehow manages to hit the spot and re-energizes you for the rest of the afternoon or night!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Amazing hot chocolate. New Tree has amazing vegan options. Their chocolate is tasty but make sure you try their food as well - their soups are great as are their veggies burgers.

Very nice staff and New tree has a soothing ambiance. Great place for a casual coffee or treat.

Enjoy!
author: Maude B.

description:
NewTree is a tiny cafe tucked off of 1st St on Stevenson. I had popped in once before and grabbed a slice of quiche and hadn't returned until today. Quaint, refreshing, and filled with delicious treats, this place has a lot of potential if it wasn't for their meh service..

At around 2pm, this place was BUMPIN. Line out the door, tables filled. Of course my friend and I didn't know what we wanted so we kindly stepped aside while we made up our minds. Giggling while trying to decide we were treated very dismissively by the cashier who seemed bothered that 1) we couldn't decide what to get and 2) were having a good time together. C'mon lady! It's 2pm on a Thursday! Lighten up!

Once we did finally decide, we received our drinks and soup very quickly and decided to sit outside since we didn't feel very welcomed inside.. The cauliflower soup was actually delicious, as was the brownie, and the small sample of almond hot chocolate I tried. Prices are a little steeper than I'd like to pay for items so simple, but I must say everything was clearly high quality and more than just your average soup or hot chocolate.

If service wasn't so snooty and serious, this could definitely become a regular lunch and or hot chocolate spot for me, but considering how judgmental they were of something as simple as enjoying a Thursday afternoon with an old friend, not sure if I'll be back..
author: Rachel L.

description:
So I recently got a job nearby so I came here about 5 times now. I really love the store atmosphere, not to mention that great quiche, yummy muffin and gluten free cookies. So I have no complaints with the store. HOWEVER, I do with one of the lady that works there. I really find her very rude. Everytime I come here, she has that very arrogant attitude. I asked her about the types of muffins and she says it like I should know it already. She says it so quickly that I was still confused. Right after she gave me a quick glance that I was hesitant, he walks away. Is that how you treat customers? I waited for the barista to help finishing making coffee for another customer, so he can help me. 

The other time I came was when I got my cookie. For some reason, I really feel as if she doesn't want to work there. She was very annoyed as I asked if they were all gluten cookies. 

Honestly, if you can't tell me those small basic info about the food. Why are you working? :( Please Note that I dont want to get her fired or anything but I feel having that negative attitude towards customers really makes the customers uncomfortable. 

Overall, I really think they should work on their CS. As much as I love their food, I don't want to go back because I don't want that same chick to help me.
author: Lina L.

description:
I just started a new job less than a block away.  Decided to drop in on my way to Jack in the Box since it just looked so fresh.

There's usually someone passing out samples outside I think because it's new.  The people who work in there are SO friendly, though.  Easy to talk to and don't try to hurry you.

Now... FOOD!

I (am currently eating) the Quinoa Flax salad.. which comes with arugula, cherry tomatoes, peas, broccoli and a little bread roll.  It was $8 or $9 dollars, which I suppose is pretty steep for a salad (since there are other places in the area to get salads), but... so good.  I think I read organic somewhere. 

The portion size of the salad is great!  Just the right amount to keep you from over eating.  You can choose from 3 dressings: balsamic, some type of berry vinagrette, and a spicy carrot!  I went with balsamic because I'm boring, but I think I'll try to the spicy vingarette next time.

It's too bad that this isn't in a better location where more people could see it!  Their dressing also comes in a little containers that are also sized well.  Since so many people ask for dressing on the side nowadays, this is convenient!
author: Jennifer L.

description: I love this little place. I am vegan and can count on a delicious vegan soup every day -- except when they've run out! They rotate the soups, and they're all delicious! The soup is really the best item, and I also really like the vegan hot chocolate -- $5, but worth it. I also love the vibe, they're always screening a nature video, and have lots of little plants. Nice zen oasis in the harried, all-business financial district.
author: Laura A.

description: We couldn't get a table at Yank Sing during lunch hour and ended up across from it at NewTree. Healthy food that's reasonably priced at a cozy little corner just off Market St. I got a cup of the vegan pumpkin soup (delicious and creamy) and their quinoa burger for under $10. There is complementary lemon infused water served by the carafe. The quinoa burger was spiced with Indian curry flavors and served on a whole wheat bun. Just ask to have it heated up. Hmmm ... I love it when vegan tastes this good.
author: Ute L.

description: Came here to grab a quick cup of coffee, so I probably missed how special the place is supposed to be. Just your super basic cafe. The baristas are nice but kinda lifeless. I ordered a regular cup of black coffee, but they were confused about my order... I don't even know. My friend also had his order mixed up. Anyways, it's a cute little cafe with barstool seating on the other side of the register. Good place to catch up with friends, if anything.
author: Stefanie C.

description: Great place for lunch and super friendly staff. Free wifi and amazing chocolate options and vegan/veg options!
author: Christine H.

description: I love this place! It's a little expensive but the food is all fresh tasting and pretty much vegan besides a couple of meat offerings. I did almost get booted out for not ordering anything and sitting inside during the "lunch rush"... So that's why they get one star off, I'm still butt hurt I guess.  :/
author: Natalie B.

description:
Highlights
- When I heard that they serve quinoa for lunch, i was so there! It's an added plus that they specialize in chocolate as well and offer so many unique flavors. 
- Small shop with a few tables and chairs. 
- Quinoa Flax with super fruit vinaigrette (quinoa tossed with arugula, broccoli, tomatoes, herbs, lemon and flax seeds). When i first came, they served this and allowed you to pick and get your own dressing, but it was a nice healthy and quick lunch. Portion size is a bit small, but it was fresh. 
- Their chocolate is to die for. They have so many different varieties. I tried a sampler pack and would recommend if you can't decide. The black currant and lavender is my favorite. So smooth and subtle flavor = perfection. 

Improvements
- Location is hidden and hard to find without their various signs on busy sidewalks

Tip
- Grab your food, get some chocolate, and head outside to a public outdoor seating area and enjoy some people watching.
author: Tracy T.

description:
So far I've had only their Almond Mexican hot chocolate but it is insanely delicious! It is rich and creamy and just delicious. Be sure to get an 8oz or at least a stick with 12oz. Anything larger is just too much for such a rich drink. 

Hoping to head back sometime when I'm a bit hungry to try some of their yummy looking treats and lunches.
author: Jaedra D.

description: I enjoy their salads and giant gluten free cookies! Food is pretty fresh and very convenient.
author: Shalana M.

description: The quinoa burger is SO delish! It was such a surprise to try such a delicious sandwich. It's a little over $7 and you can get it toasted. It comes with some sort of spinach hummus spread that's so delicious! I can't tell you how much my coworkers and I find this so tasty. I think I may go back for this or something else! Loved it! I actually think they may run out if you go too late in the day.
author: Priya S.

description: I was disappointed in my wrap and soup.  It tasted ummm unique I guess? Not in a good way? Well although my tastebuds weren't all that happy maybe the 80 year old me will have a different opinion. Oh yeah. And. Portion = Too small. Maybe I should try the chocolate next time.
author: Esther S.

description: Tucked away in the alley, is this fun little Belgian coffee shop. Help yourself to samples of all the unique chocolates! You will also get a little chocolate with your coffee. There is free wi-fi, and a few styles of seating (including couches in the corner).
author: Amy M.

description: I am going to stop going to New Tree. They wanted $7.50 for a small volume of yogurt with a tiny amount of granola. That's obnoxious!!! Go to Coffee Bar on Montgomery for better coffee, cooler staff and more yogurt with two or three toppings of your choice ($4.50).
author: Eddie L.

description: I came here to try the hot chocolate on a cold, foggy summer morning, hoping it would lift my spirits. I am grateful that they sample the hot chocolate, because after tasting it I found it too cloying and declined to purchase it. The gal working was super friendly, which, in the end, lifted my spirits.
author: Patricia D.

description:
This review is mainly for their quinoa flax salad.

A little about myself, I love meat and carbs, and ordering a salad for lunch is really rare. If I was forced to, I would occasionally order a chicken cobb or chicken caesar salad, but mainly for their croutons. 

Anyway, I was super curious about quinoa since I've never had it before and decided to stop by New Tree since my office building is 20 feet away. I am obsessed! I think it's because it reminds me of fried rice (and I love fried rice). I usually pair it with this orange dressing they have, so I have yet to try the other dressings. It's super filling and the broccoli & tomatoes add really good flavor and texture to it.

I still can't justify paying $10 for a salad, but I will make an exception for this salad.

Oh and try not to toss the salad near your keyboard, because the quinoa can get out of control and fly into the crevices... haha.
author: Sandy M.

description: I enjoy this place because of the many fresh healthy options and friendly staff.  After trying several items I realized it depends upon what you get, as you might gather from conflicting reviews.   Last time I had one of the meal-sized salads and it was just OK.  This time, I had been considering the quinoa burger and was swayed by having a sample.  The full size was even better, on a good bun that was nicely toasted, lots of flavor.  I probably didn't need the small Summer Greens salad but was very glad I included it; the fresh crunch and delicious avocado made for a well-rounded lunch.  The whole shebang was a little over $11 which is not cheap unless you remember you're in the FiDi where even a boring sandwich costs $8 or more.  Muffins are as good as they look, so I think that's another winner here.
author: Sandy M.

description:
The chocolate bars are ridiculously over priced. To add insult to injury they don't taste very good at all. I got a bar of the newtree milk and it's pretty waxy tasting. 

They seem to be proud that they add agave fiber...dumb idea. It is probably what gives it the yucky feel and is totally unnecessary. You don't eat expensive chocolate bars as a fiber supplement.

I probably could have bought two Scharfenberger bars for the money.
author: D R.

description:
I was feeling particularly impressionable one day and allowed a chalk board set up on the sidewalk of market street point me in the direction of New Tree café. I'm glad that I did!  The location of the café is across from Yang Sing, in a quaint, re-purposed SOMA alley. The store appears to specialize in "health" forward, Belgian, organic chocolate and snacks. They offer a variety of healthy salads for $5 and several pre-made sandwiches for $5-8.

I ordered the Quinoa burger ($7.95), which they grilled to order. I was also a victim of the impulse basket full of specialty chocolates located at the cash register and decided on the dark chocolate with Belgian cookie and flax seed. Yes, the healthfulness of the flax seed certainly made this treat a little bit less of a splurge. At a price of $2.5 for an oz of chocolate, that was another type of splurge, but my body is worth it!

I thoroughly enjoyed the Quinoa burger, it had great texture and the wait time to have it grilled, 4 minutes, was just enough time for me to sample several additional flavors of their chocolate. Favorites included the dark chocolate with thyme and the ginger dark chocolate. Four stars instead of five as I think the chocolate is a bit over priced. Also, when they grilled my sandwich I would have preferred they removed the lettuce and put it back in after it was cooked. I'm not a fan of hot lettuce.
author: Ariel M.

description:
Finally a coffee shop that has almond milk and agave! If you're reading this review years later perhaps other coffee retailers have figured this out by now. Speaking of figure, my figure and my wallet thanks them!

 In addition to excellent almond milk lattes they also have a variety of tasty snacks and lunches. Every flavor of kale chips, nuts, fruit and the works.  I tried a small container of the Belgian Summer salad and was blown away. So glad to have a truly healthy option near work! Couple this with friendly service and you've got a loyal customer for life!
author: Chris W.

description:
Really clean and contemporary atmosphere.  A nice place to relax and escape the pressures of the city.  Conveniently tucked away in the alley away from the hustle and bustle of market street.  

The drinks were well made and tasted on point.  It's pretty small so you gotta go at the right time otherwise you'll find yourself standing for awhile.  

I wish they were open later though!
author: Dennis C.

description:
Mint and Pea pesto with goat cheese on an Acme olive roll!!! I'm in heaven. Oh, not to mention the Quinoa and Flax dark chocolate and the amazing Euro-accents/friendly service.....

My first time at NewTree will not be the last.
author: Liz W.

description: Overprice and not good. Their almond gluten free and vegan hot chocolate has a very savory taste as if some kind of spice was added to it but the taste is very off putting. Their gluten free vegan chocolate chip is really dry and crumbly...not all at representative of a traditional soft chocolate chip cookie and the added salt is overpowering. I have to eat gluten free vegan because I'm gluten and lactose intolerant but options like this makes it not worth looking for substitutes.
author: Mai C.

description: So they have two locations in SF - it appears that both locations have a similar interior.  What a fantastic addition to the financial district, on California.  I tried one of their sample soups and it was excellent.  I then ordered a Moroccan style chicken salad sandwich that they warm up for you.  While you wait for that to warm up, they have at least twenty different types of chocolates for you to try - OMG, so good.  I would have bought each one of them except they're about $7 each!  Some of the best chocolate that rivals the finer chocolates in the city, recchiuti included. Must try.  Very zen.  Very friendly staff too - they all seemed to be from a different country.  Interesting roots and history - very fitting.  Looking forward to going back for more.
author: Ketan D.

description:
I really, really like the concept of this place.  The venue lives up to the hype as well (except for that front door that is not weighted as you'd expect when you open it).  The menu is intriguing and there seems to be chocolate everywhere.  So far, so good.

Then, the attention to detail wanders a bit.  There are many veggie options = yay.  Some of them have nuts in them that are not called out on the menu = death.  What we got was good, tasted fresh and was innovative, but unexpectedly bland.  There were whiffs of interesting tastes, but nothing that stood out in the end.  

Service, from soup to nuts, was distracted.  They did not notice the lady that shoplifted a sandwich and kept trying to clear my personal items from the table or take my food before I'd finished eating it.

I'd like to see a little more dedication to the menu and the service, and then I'd be happy to be a regular.  Have some nut-free brownies, and I'd be a fan.
author: Andi T.

description:
You know that chocolate sauce you dip churros in? It's kinda thick, but it's also kinda watery?

Yeah, that's NewTree's spiced Belgian hot chocolate. Actually, it's vegan hot chocolate because it's made with almond milk. Also, it's got a variety of spices that make it less of the typical powdered hot chocolate you're used to, and more of a sophisticated hot chocolate.

Like, "ooh, what's that? Oh, is that nutmeg? And it's got a hint of asafoetida!"*

*Just kidding it doesn't have any hints of asafoetida. (Look it up, you uncultured swine.)

When I'm in the mood for hot chocolate, I typically have a very particular expectation of it (picture a roaring fire, fingerless gloves, a super-comfy sofa, and a gigantic mug of hot chocolate topped with mini marshmallows). NewTree's doesn't meet that expectation, but it isn't awful either. I'd recommend you stopping in and getting a small sample--of which they're happy to provide.

Speaking of which, the staff's incredibly friendly and accommodating. One of the only reasons this place gets an extra star.
author: Adena B.

description:
This is right next to my office so if I'm in a hurry or don't want to walk anywhere too far I end up here. 

It's a cute little cafe and I've only tried their soup and salad combos. Everything tastes fresh and has good flavors but it is a bit on the pricer side then I would like to pay. 

Their sandwiches, chocolates, and Belgian hot chocolate look really good so I will be back to try these soon!
author: Christine W.

description: I was a regular patron of New Tree Cafe until this morning when I witnessed despicable behavior by one of the regular employees.toward a fellow customer. I will never return to this cafe again. The employee is a regular employee, approx 25 years old, blond, and with a heavy foreign accent. And never friendly, always rude to patrons. Today was the last straw when I watched him THROW the credit card belonging to a fellow employee on the ground, and berate him for cell phone use in the cafe. Needless to say, this employee should be fired immediately. New Tree you have just lost a regular customer and I will be spreading the word to my colleagues in the area.
author: Mary P.

description:
Overpriced. $11.50 for a salad primarily comprised of cabbage and onion. Packaging is not compostable even though they told me it was. And unapologetic, extremely slow staff. 
Question: "Can I get an asparagus soup?" Answer: "We just ran out." 
Wrong, answer should be, "I'm so sorry, we just ran out."

Another problem. Why are you running out of soup at 12:30?
author: Rachel P.

description:
Want to attend a chocolate tasting? NewTree cafe not only has wonderful chocolate bars in great flavors (including cinnamon, thyme, chile pepper and cherry) and hot chocolate, but they also offer the opportunity to taste ALL their chocolate bars the whole time they are open. There are little glass containers of chocolate next to the each displayed chocolate bar. Constant, thorough chocolate tasting gets them 5 stars.

But more things get them stars. Their chocolate is fair trade and organic and some of their bars have flax seeds, which give a nice crisp mouth experience (think rice crispies, but tinier). Flax is GOOD for you (omega 3s), so this makes these chocolate bars health food.

Vegan hot chocolate (uses almond milk) with cinnamon and nutmeg is amazing. They offer a vegan mocha using the vegan hot chocolate - and it is wonderful.
 
Their brownie is astonishing - dark coffee and carmel notes with a great cakey texture. It is my husband's favorite brownie ever and would be my favorite brownie, too, if not for the nuts (I just don't like nuts in brownies, although I like this one so much that I'll get it again).

They have regular food (organic) to serve with their chocolate.

This cafe is across from Yank Sing's Stevenson location, so I have a bad tendency to go to this cafe either before or after a Yank Sing dim sum-a-thon.
author: Vena V.

description: Super friendly staff and healthy food. Also very good for vegetarians. I usually bring food from home to the office, but once in a while I eat out and when I do, I go to New Tree. So far I had their quinoa salad and couscous salad and surprisingly they contain a lot of quinoa/couscous in them. Super tasty! And their dressings are awesome, too, adding to the feel of freshness. You also get a slice of bread with it. It feels as if they care that you eat a wholesome lunch. Love their quinoa burger and oatbars. Overall, the food is tasty and healthy and the place has a great atmosphere!
author: Malin D.

description: Excellent vegetarian menu. The breakfast wrap and other sandwiches are what keep me coming back.
author: Steve M.

description:
This place is right next to my office, and so my co-workers and I go here pretty regularly.  It's very reliable: always fresh, lines move quickly (since  there are always a few salads that are pre-made for the lunch hour and ready-to-grab), and the people who work there are refreshingly kind and friendly.  I've tried a few salads and all are pretty good (the tomato dressing is my favorite).  Teas are nice as well.  Good place for quick lunch, to-go lunch, or also to grab tea or coffee mid-afternoon since they have a couple of couches, nooks, and outdoor tables.  Ambiance outside is nice since it's tucked away on Stevenson away from most of the loud traffic.
Tried two of the chocolates (a server came by and gave them to my friend and me to sample while we were having coffee) and they're also really tasty - especially the almond one which had a nice unique flavor.
author: Carolyn P.

description: OMG hot chocolate sample is OOFFFFF the hook!
author: Minerva L.

description:
I am eating the feta leek quiche as we speak and I am in complete heaven!!! I have loved this place since the day they first opened doors and offered me free organic chocolate.
