This was the first place that I had a cold brew. If you don't know what that is, go in and find out. Best cup of iced coffee you'll ever have! 

I think they give student discounts to GGU students? I have never asked but thought I overheard someone in front of me ask for the discount.

There is free wi-fi and cozy little tables indoors and outdoors to sit at. I enjoy the succulents and decor throughout this cute little cafe.
author: Lorianne E.

description:
I wanted to try something new and healthy for lunch today. Since NewTree is across the street from my office I wanted to give it a shot. 

The lunch menu is on the small-ish side but I was able to find 2 good options. The soup of the day was a vegan carrot/squash which I had a sample of and ordered a full size because I liked it so much. With their lunch deal of soup + sandwich I chose a hummus & veggie sando. All of their salads and sandwiches are pre-made. Some of the sandwiches they will panini press for you. Plus, they have all kinds of chocolate items - I tried a few samples and I would go back for the granola lime chocolate bar. 

A great addition to the area for grabbing a quick and healthy lunch.
author: Sara P.

description:
Ok this was a gem of a find. My coworker stumbled upon this place one day, raved about it and brought us all back here. Since that day, I have been coming here at least once a week.

They have really good Coffee, fantastic salads (try their raw Brussel Sprout Salad - mmmmmmmmmmmm) and amazing chocolate samples. You must, must, must have a sample of their Lavendar Chocolate. It will blow your mind.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Good service. Good cup of coffee. 
They have almond milk. (Starbucks does not. You have to ask the barista at Peets)
Got a small organic quinoa salad there once. It was tasty, but too expensive.
Their Belgian chocolates are tasty treats.
author: Mike C.

description:
I discovered New Tree while going on a 30 day Vegan plan. I became obsessed with their Backyard Greens kale salad with chocolate dressing. Yes, chocolate salad dressing...delicious! I come in for it at 3x a week for lunch.

They have recently become apart of my morning routine as well. I have become quite fond of their lattes, especially the Dirty Chai and Matcha Green Tea. They can make them with almond milk and always come out rich and creamy. Gives you the decadence you deserve for the calories ;-)

The staff is SUPER friendly, always smiling and helpful. The atmosphere is just as lovely and a perfect to get a breather from the office. My home away from home!
author: Aman A.

description: I tried both the chicken avocado salad and the thai salad and they were both two of the worst salads I've ever eaten - extremely dry chicken, watery dressing. Bleh.
author: Yuriy B.

description:
This is the second time to New Tree, the quinoa burger is fabulous but today I went for the post and goat cheese sandwich.  Amazing.  

The people are always friendly and the offerings are tasty while maintaining the organic/natural options I'm looking for during the lunch hour.  

The sweets and chocolate are fantastic and if you don't try their Belgian hit chocolate you are missing a true treat. 

Pretty sure I've found my new lunch spot.
author: Joshua D.

description:
I'd never heard of Newtree chocolate until I walked into this new cafe/retail shop by my office, but the owner told me they've been selling their products in some premium grocers like Whole Foods, Andronico's, etc. They're a Belgium-based company and San Francisco is their first retail outlet. Their chocolate is mostly flavored chocolate bars, and are certified organic and fair trade. They definitely really push the organic/fair trade vibe in this cafe. Everything is made of recycled/compostable/environmentally-friendly material. There's some cool bamboo awning decorating the walls/ceiling and even the ground is made of some kind of pebble mixture. 

For the retail portion, hey have some pretty unique flavors, like thyme, cinnamon, ginger, and lavender chocolate bars. They also sell baking chips and other baked goods/sweets. They also sell some environmentally friendly products like reusable utensils, solar panel chargers for your ipod, plants, etc.

I think they're still working on their menu but i had a green pea pesto on acme bread that was delicious! The qunioa was also decent, but the lavender chocolate pudding was sublime! I have to stay away from that. The cappucino I had was not bad, not as strong as I would have liked, but the barista said they're still working on their menu and will probably have some unique drinks coming to the menu soon.

Hours are currently Mon - Friday 7 AM - 6 PM. I talked to the owner and he said they might have some evening speakers on sustainability/fair trade/organic foods, etc. 

There's some standing tables and also a sofa/sitting section. It's pretty spacious and definitely a refreshing space to have in the heart of downtown!
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Just got some tea from here today. It's a little hard to find but pretty worth it. Nice change from the mundane Starbucks/Peet's world. 

Didn't try the food but it looked good! Thanks NewTree for the caffeine boost!

Note: There is limited inside and outside seating. We sat outside where there were about 2 tables with 2 seats each.
author: Robert S.

description:
New lunch places are always great....especially when they are healthy options!

I popped in and decided on an almond hot chocolate ($3.25) which is served with clove and orange zest.  The flavors are really good together!

For lunch I ordered the quinoa salad ($8.75) and a brownie ($3.25).  The salad was really fresh.  It had quinoa, a variety of tomatoes, broccoli and just the right amount of greens.  It was really light and refreshing.  The brownie was okay.  It was a little too hard for my taste...but everything else was really good!  My total lunch was $15.25.

Check them out!  Their staff is really nice and friendly too!
author: Sofia H.

description: The iced lattes here are delicious. And right on the way to campus. Score.
author: Mel G.

description:
Its great to have a coffee shop that is different from all the others. They have this European vibe about them and the atmosphere inside is very zen and relaxing, even though it is right off Market St.  The lunch sandwich and soup was pretty good, though it could use some more spice and salt/pepper.

I like the change of pace so I keep coming back. There is only natural sweetener, none of my usual Splenda, and the sugar is too thick to dissolve. Other than that little annoyance, the coffee is great. 4.5 stars overall.
author: Brett G.

description:
This is a great cafe that focuses on sustainable, fresh, and organic ingredients. They have a wide variety of coffee, soups of the day, sandwiches, and salads. The best part about this place is their beautiful chocolate wall. It features each of their chocolate bars with little glass containers of free samples next to them. You can try milk chocolate with lavendar, dark chocolate with berries, milk chocolate with quinoa and flax, etc. 

NewTree is definitely worth a visit. Every purchase supports the Amazon rainforest and no matter what, you can sample free chocolate. :)
author: Alice J.

description:
This is one of my go-to lunch places in the area. I've held off on writing a review for almost a year since it was a little hit-or-miss in their earlier days and I liked them enough to give them a chance. And now, after all this time, going at least 2 or 3 times a week, I am happy to say it's now always a very pleasant experience! 

My co-workers and I have nicknamed this place "The Spa" and that about sums it up. The decor is cute, clean, lots of plants, and bamboo surfaces, and green. I am a sucker for the nature documentaries they're always showing on their TV too. I always get the soup + salad (usually quinoa flax) combo and it fills me right up. Their soups change everyday - I love when they have the sweet potato coconut or split pea. Some of the other soups (asparagus) are not quite as good, but I enjoy the variety. When I'm feeling particularly decadent, I'll get their dirty chai latte with almond milk which is some of the best I've ever had. Not too sweet, lots of spice, nicely thick and foamy on top. Yum!!! They have a ton of pastries too (lots of vegan and gf options) and I am partial to their almond florentines. Don't forget the wall of chocolate samples!! I never forget to snag a few on my way out - my favorites are the Thyme and Cinnamon flavors. 

The people are friendly and there's minimal lines or waiting. I usually get my food, find a table or sofa to perch on, and read a book while I'm eating. Great place to take a nice, rejuvenating break over lunch!
author: Carol C.

description:
Since I work in the area it is not unusual for my coworkers and I to visit NewTree twice a day. Sometimes three! Today, for example, I had NewTree's drip coffee and chocolate/nut oatmeal for breakfast and am currently enjoying their Belgian Brussels Sprout salad (my fav!) for lunch. I am also a huge fan of their grilled vegetable sandwich! 

If you love lavender, be sure to sample their lavender milk chocolate - I do every time!

I would give NewTree 5 stars but the girls who work there need to work on their customer service. Being the frequent customer that I am, I would expect by now that they'd know my name and have my order down...except instead the norm is no welcome, no smile and no acknowledgment that they've seen me twice today. It's the quality of the chocolates, coffees and food that keep me coming back. Once they get customer service down...5 starts will surely come their way!
author: Sarah Z.

description:
I absolutely LOVE this place! Beautiful, sustainable decor...local, organic food...and, of course, scrumptious chocolate!

See my blog post for more info: http://www.successandchocolate.com/post/24217047194/newtree
author: Peggy B.

description: Lots of vegan options!!! They use almond milk instead of soy, which is wonderful. Super tasty rich hot chocolate and chai made with real spices. The food is kind of meh, but the drinks and chocolate are great!
author: Kate B.

description:
I dropped in here for lunch after sampling the chocolate and brie on raisin bread in the alley outside. After also sampling the chocolate mi-cuit (delicious!), I purchased a hot vegetarian sandwich with zucchini, squash, carrot, cheese, and chocolate mole. Tasty and filling for $5.95. 

The interior design is beautiful and peaceful, featuring bamboo staves along the wall and ceiling, hanging terrariums, solar powered chargers, exposed brick, and two lovely brown sofas. I even took a few pictures to help me in designing a new room in my house.
author: Dylan ..

description:
New trendy, peaceful place to enjoy your breakfast, lunch or afternoon coffee. I have been told that is the world's first NewTree café (Newtree is a small sustainable/responsible chocolate company). 

I really enjoyed the organic salad (straight from the farmers market) followed by a delicious cappuccino with some ginger chocolate.  If you want to have some unique, sensory experiences, this is the place to go. I couldn't resist buying some Belgian waffles on the way out :-)

Fun fact: the offer vegan hot chocolate... I guess that must be a world's premiere !

Go and check it out !
author: Tanguy P.

description: I happened across NewTree on my way to a meeting.  I was pleasantry surprised by the warm & welcoming atmosphere, with several quick healthy options for lunch.  I purchased a pre-packaged kale salad with toasted hazelnuts, pomegranate seeds, & other tasty treats.  They also offer complimentary wifi.  My only disappointment was the lack of choices of salad dressing.  I ended up going dressingless because the two options were not gluten free/dairy free.  All I wanted was some simple olive oil & vinegar.  I'll be back for a quick healthy lunch & to try some chocolate if they offer more dressing options!
author: Mary L.

description: I use to love going here for their delicious and super healthy salads. But recently they shrank the size of their to-go salad containers and now you barely get any lettuce with the salad toppings. Also $11 for a salad the size of a side salad is a bit too much.
author: Liana L.

description:
This place is pretty good. I've had the Hot Chocolate and the Belgian Mocha.

On my first visit, the server offered me a sample of the hot chocolate before I committed, explaining that some people found the flavor odd or too strong. I appreciated the attention! And I liked it. It's the organic flavor; I used to work on a farm that grew organic cacao, and that sip took me back... 

My request: let's try different varieties of hot chocolate! Lavendar, honey, cardamom, rose, mint, coconut, vanilla--there's endless potential!! You have great variety in your chocolate bars. Take a cue French Broad Chocolate in Asheville, NC and get that goodness into liquid form! (And, readers, if you're ever in western NC--get yourself a Liquid Truffle.)
author: Liza C.

description: It's the anti Mixt Greens! Grab and go salads with more kale than other greens, cheap, quick, and no questions asked. It's the anti dim sum across the alley too. They're chocolate wall is the anti Whole Foods. It's like this shop said to all the titans of the area, we're gonna do this thing and we're not afraid to put chocolate salad dressing on the menu either. You can fulfill every stereotype of a healthy lunch here: kombucha, kale, quinoa. I'm in.
author: Jon A.

description:
I loved that you could sample all of the different types of chocolate.  I refrained from doing so, but I think they something like 15 kinds.

They need to work on a lunch menu and also on doing something as simple as ringing up a purchase.  It took way too long for me to buy a bar of chocolate. 

They just opened 5 days ago, though, so give it a shot.
author: B. Y.

description:
Great place to get a healthy and tasty lunch - or simply have a break from work around a cafe and a croissant 
everything is organic 
and you can taste all the different sorts of Newtree chocolate 

finally, i love the bamboo ceiling - have a look next time you are in the neighborhood
author: Arnaud C.

description: I've been here a handful of times as it is very close to where I work. The food is okay, it's a little pricy but I've come to expect that with organic and vegan food. The staff seem a little out of it and sometimes unfriendly (every time I've gone in the staff has been different). I went in the morning once for breakfast and another person and I ordered food and despite having 5 people behind the counter they messed up our orders and it took a long time to get our food. The place is cute though and there's plenty of room to sit and hang out.
author: Nika R.

description: I usually grab a quick coffee here in the morning. Great vibe and staff is super friendly. The coffee here is excellent and they have  a big screen TV on the wall that plays Planet Earth in an endless loop so you can watch nature, red in tooth and claw as you sip your morning bean.
author: Rudy T.

description:
Fantastic latte

This is the best latte in my neighborhood. Besides being essential for starting my day, sometimes it even comes with a tiny sample of their chocolate, yum! In addition to their coffee drinks, I have mostly had muffins (zucchini is my favorite). Their choose-your-toppings oatmeal and breakfast quiches seem to be favorites. I haven't been for lunch yet, but the emphasis is on organic and vegan. Sadly I have to avoid chocolate, but during the holidays they had some lavender nougat - I loved it so much I sent some to a friend as a Christmas gift.

The staff here are truly nice, friendly people. They recognize their frequent customers and remember your order. They are so nice that they even helped me out when I accidentally locked myself out of my condo.
author: Marilyn S.

description: Best Caprese Sandwich ever!  The place had a non-stop line at around 1:15 PM.  Coffee is great as well, and so was the vegan peanut butter cookie I had.  With coffee you get a very small bar of chocolate.  Nice touch!  All the decor and materials used in the cafe are from sustainable and recycled products.  I like their tag line:  Savor Life!
author: Celeste F.

description:
Decoration - 5*

Chocolate and presentation - 5*

Premaid! sandwich (chicken)  with way too much bread and too little contents - 2*

Soup of the day (vegetable puree) - 3*

Green Tea - 4*

Service - 4*

Overpriced.
author: Anastasia B.

description:
I ordered the Matcha Latte today and it was aight.

The Latte had a strong matcha taste which was good. But i think they were able to do that by using a lot of matcha powder, which leads to a latte that was thick in consistency. I just didn't like the texture of it.

The drink was also pretty pricey ringing up @ $5.50.
author: Terry C.

description: My new favorite place for lunch because they have a couch and oh their salads are good too!  The people, food and ambiance is great.    Make sure to get their Kale salad, you'll thank me later.  I can eat lunch here everyday plus they give out free chocolate!
author: Kristina A.

description: Not the place for salads, apparently. Rotten lettuce and rock hard avocado. I'd like to try their hot chocolate but I'm not expecting to return any time soon.
author: Zara L.

description: Nice and small cafe. I had their soup of the day (Peas and Cabbage) and the they recommended me Vegan Quinoa burger and they even grilled it. Burger was really amazing. In addition to the food options, they have a barista too with a good size lounge kind of area. Really nice place. After all they sell different chocolate, i tried a few samples. I do not have a sweet tooth but i do believe people who are into it will definitely like the chocolates sold here. Worth the visit and will definitely go again to try other items on their menu.
author: Ashok L.

description:
Love the ambience, but this place is way too overpriced. Their hot chocolate is now pre-made, not made by order. The resulting taste is a little flatter and over-spiced in my opinion. TCHO gets more customers and they still make everything fresh by hand. In addition, do NOT get the croissants!! For $4, they are so dry, I almost choked! I had to toast mine thoroughly but it ended up like a sponge. 

Looking at the menu, they have a number of basic sandwiches but each for $6-7. I feel in general, their prices are definitely higher than other places with similar business philosophies. I will probably continue visiting if I'm in need of a quick sweet snack, as they have a number of lovely confections like nougat, chocolate disks studded with dried fruits/nuts, and digestive-like cookie fingers. Just not the croissant....
author: Nicole L.

description:
Delicious!  I went in yesterday to check out their chocolate assortment, and I came back today to try their Belgium salad.  For the chocolates, they have some very creative combinations, all made in a Belgium style, with things from lime and granola, to quinoa, to chili peppers.  You can sample every flavor, which makes it easy to purchase your favorite.

As for the salad, I am a huge fan!  It was finely shaved Brussels Sprouts with what tasted like mint.  I had the chocolate vinaigrette, which was savory and delicious.  There was crumbled feta, toasted almond slivers and dried fruit to top it off.  It was a perfect size for $8.75, all organic and local ingredients.  I get a little annoyed with all the $12 salads, so this one was just perfect for me:  price-wise and taste-wise.

The staff is very friendly and the cafe is very light and airy.  It's a nice place to spend the lunch hour.  Yum!  I can't wait to go back.
author: Stephanie R.

description: Becoming a favorite morning stop for me.  Excellent lattes served here.  The vegetarian breakfast wrap is large and very tasty with egg cheese and spinach. Nice seating inside and outside available.
author: A V.

description:
I feel gypped! Over 10 bucks for a prepackaged salad comprised of a pile of leaves, dry chicken cubes, and 3 thin slices of browned avocado. Also there is no dressing so all you get is the taste of raw vegetables in your mouth. There may have been dressing on the side but we were not informed of that and it was too late once I had already left and started eating. In fact the cashier had a bizarre lack of customer service. He did not acknowledge us when we entered. When we ordered the salad her merely pointed to the prepackaged salads in the refrigerator. And when we paid he let out an unintelligible grunt. That was the extent of our interaction!

We took two bites of our salad and decided to box it up. We're not hungry after this experience!
author: Kevin C.

description: Nice, different healthy offering in FiDi! Tasty soups (even when I thought... really? But the zucchini soup was yummy!), decent sandwiches and okay salads. Have tried their lower sugar chocolate spread and it's pretty good, but I think I like go lo better. People are pretty nice. It's tucked away, so keep your eyes peeled for the signs in the alleyway.
author: Ara S.

description:
$6 for a 2-bite, pre-made, mediocre "sandwich"?  No thank you.

I give it 6 months.
author: B D.

description:
They have a nice selection of different things, but the "special" hummus carrot sandwich I had was overpriced.  7 dollars for a 50 cent bun, less than half a carrot, two pieces of lettuce, and maybe 4 Tablespoons of hummus.  It was tasty, but it's kind of hard to screw up something so barebones.

I will come back and try some chocolate though.
author: Tmon B.

description:
I was really hoping for a good organic lunch with my friend.... but it was really disappointing. 

We got a taste of the carrot and coriander soup, it definitely needed more seasoning. Then they were out of both salads, so we got 2 little mini goat cheese with pesto sandwiches and the grilled veggie sandwich. 

6 bucks for a tiny pre-made sandwich is a rip off and it did not taste that good at all. The grilled veggie was also very disappointing. Had I knew that everything was pre-made, I wouldn't gotten that Bloomspot deal. I was hoping for a warm buttered crunchy sandwich filled with wholesome veggies and mushrooms, but instead it was mostly bread, not well flavored and a little soggy. 

Chocolate was good, and brownie was good too. 

On our way, out they asked how it was. I lied and said it was good, and they replied "a free lunch is always good"..... What free lunch? I paid for the Bloomspot, which wasn't even worth it at the discounted price. 

I do appreciate the "green" initiatives here. So I bumped them up 1 star. Otherwise, it would have been a 1 star experience. My friend was just as disappointed.
author: Cake W.

description: Healthy Belgian chocolate and healthy food downtown? Yup! Win. I love the decor--very natural feel in the middle of downtown SF.
author: Vero K.

description:
This is my 2nd visit to NewTree Cafe. My first visit was a few months ago, I was tempted to try their hot chocolate. It was very rich, but it was good. I hang out for a little bit to sample their free chocolate :)
Today I went in because I was on yelp looking for a place to get a salad for lunch, so when I seen that NewTree has a quinoa salad with a blueberry vinaigrette I was excited to go there. It's conveniently located around the corner from where I work. 
The quinoa salad I got was already made, and I knew it was fresh and organic. It was a good size bowl and it was filled up. I was a little sad they didn't have that dressing when I went in, but that's ok. They had some interesting flavors of dressing though. There was a chocolate dressing, an all fruit dressing, and I can't remember what the other one was called, but it was orange. I got the all fruit dressing and you can also get a piece of bread if you like. 
My quinoa salad was really good, came with chopped tomatoes, flax seed, broccoli  and arugula. The al fruit dressing taste amazing, next time I will get 2 dressings because one isn't enough for the salad. 
I will definitely come here again when I want to eat quinoa salad, and I don't have to walk far to get it  :)
author: Jeanie Ann D.

description: I absolutely love this place. I work close by and love stopping here to grab lunch. So far I've tried various sandwiches, soups, salads, coffee drinks, teas and, for the first time today, a quiche. The food has consistently tasted fresh and delicious - I would definitely recommend this place. The staff is friendly as well, but, more importantly, CALM. The Financial District always feels so hectic, but New Tree is a great escape away from the madness!
author: Giana C.

description: This is by far one of the best place I have EVER eaten at, the staff is nice and helpful and the food is amazing!
author: Ludo D.

description:
who knew something with the words "quinoa" and "flax" in it could taste so good?

i'm a second offender of the Quinoa Flax Salad, and both times have been equally scrumptious and thoroughly filling. (oof, i couldn't even get to dessert, and i ALWAYS try to get to have a bite of something sweet) it's as healthy as it is tasty, and has a variety of textures to keep each chew interesting.

i've had a couple of their baked goods too, and you would never guess that they were healthy! 

don't be confused by the name of the cafe, the hard to read menu on the mirrors, or the confusion of whether it's a cafe or a shop -- just go on and check out the goods, TRY IT, and you'll be as delighted as i!
author: Diana L.

description: Stopped this place as it was close to the office. Loved the all-organic ingredients used in their food and tried their Belgian Summer salad. I was pleasantly surprised that they make from scratch a chocolate and fruit vinegarette which was very tasty! Also, they make chocolate from organic cocoa beans and are greatly reduce the carbon footprint to be eco-friendly. Their dark chocolate tastes wonderful! I would go back again.
author: George C.

description: I wish I would have found this place earlier. I was a little skeptical about the quinoa burger, because it is ready-made and they just warm it up -but it is really flavorful and actually quite delicious. It was $6.95 by itself. I felt healthy after eating it, but was still a little hungry so I finished off my friend's greasy chow mein from across the lane - now I have a stomach ache. :/
author: Moline D.

description: I go to NewTree once a week to take my lunch breaks. The place is quiet with a good atmosphere, yummy products and friendly staff. I'll definitely keep returning to taste their new products and enjoy my lunch breaks.
author: Sandra C.

description:
- dark chocolate bar with lime and granola is very "limey" in the sense it has a pretty bitter after taste.
- dark chocolate spread (located at the condiments counter) - thicker and less sweet than nutella, and it definitely has that genuine dark chocolate flavor. what's cool is that it's water-based so it has less calories and less fat than usual spreads, which are oil-based. you can also buy a jar of spread to bring home...although it's crazy expensive at $8.45 for a tiny little thing. flavors are normal dark chocolate, cherry dark chocolate and orange dark chocolate. 
- decent coffee. $2 for a size small
- matcha lattes - it's nice that they have you taste your drink to make sure it's made to your liking, but for $5 i expect a bigger cup and diamonds to be sprinkled on top.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I just won their monthly raffle and got a bunch of chocolate and coffee and chocolate spreads and it is amazing. I have been coming here for a while now for random chocolate breaks or lunches and I just love it. Their food is tasty and the staff are super friendly. I am lucky that this place opened up so close to where I work.
author: Milo B.

description: They have an amazing selection of Belgium chocolate that you can taste! The coffee is pretty good as well. The place has a nice environment though the chairs are a bit to hip for me and not at all comfortable. The chocolate is ridiculous in price. It's good... But not that good! Anyway, it's worth checking out. I didn't have one, but the sandwiches looked really good.
author: Robert H.

description: I came here for lunch on one occasion and definitely plan on coming back.  This is a good take-and-go lunch place (premade salads, quiche, etc.) and the chocolate is delish.  When I came here for lunch I had a quiche, which made for a nice and light lunch.  I notice that they have appealing premade salads that have quinoa in them, but I haven't made it there in time to get more before they sell out.  I've had samples of their chocolate, which have been heavenly.  The desserts are tempting.  The service is friendly.  Will go back for a salad soon.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Had a delicious quinoa salad here today!  My only negative is that the salad label says it was supposed to come with bread and it did not.  Other than that, tasty and fresh!  I will have to go back.
author: Erin B.

description: I love their soups of the day and the free Acme bread that comes with it. Very healthy and tasty, no matter what their soup of the day is. I mean I, myself, have never been a fan of carrots, so I wasn't sure I'd like their carrot soup, but after trying it, I could say that I'm a fan. They are a little pricey, but that's because all their stuff's organic and good for your body, so I'd say it's worth the price. :)
author: Trisha D.

description:
Great place! They have a wonderful selection of salads and sandwiches that are not just healthful---they taste great and you can tell there was some thought/taste testing behind them.
Whole filberts in the salad with pomegranate seeds, kale etc---their granola bars to die for...."African Chicken salad sandwich"--superb--get it heated up--they get the ciabatta softened up---
worth a visit or two or three for certain---their chocolates are first rate as well!!
author: John S.

description:
I used NewTree chocolate in a yoga and chocolate workshop I organized in DC. It was incredible! I love everything about the products, flavors, brand, website, and the people I interacted with. I haven't been to the store in person yet, but based on how they handled business with me on the other side of the country, I would expect great things in person! 

My workshop used the lavender chocolate and the cinnamon chocolate which were appropriately paired with soothing and calming parts of the class. The students all chose the NewTree chocolate over the other types I had in class. There was a healthy comparison and high praise for NewTree.

Their well-designed website, flavor options, and health information first caught my eye when researching different companies. Once I learned more, I came away with respect for their sustainability efforts, adoration for their branding and style, and a newfound addiction to their delicious and thoughtful chocolate. 

I offer my highest recommendation to the company and Sophie, who offered me a fantastic first impression of NewTree. 

As I closed my workshop: "Namaste and savor your day!"
author: Julie B.

description:
I work on Stevenson St., right next to this new, little shop! I decided to pop in for lunch one day a few weeks ago and haven't been able to stop. It's now my favorite place to pick up a quick salad or sandwich when I'm rushing back to work. 

The salad with quinoa, arugula, and baby tomatoes is delicious. Last week when they were out of this, I ordered the soup of the day, carrot with ginger and other spices. It was also amazing, as expected. Also love to have another place that offers vegetable based soups as opposed to the cream and lard ones mass-produced at the Soup Company. I love that all of their ingredients are organic and locally sourced; you taste and feel this freshness in all of their offerings. They also sell baked goods (brownies, zucchini bread) and vegan hot chocolate (made with almond milk) and dark chocolate mousse. NewTree lets you indulge without the guilt that comes from consuming fatty, processed ingredients.
author: Melissa D.

description: Ok, this was the best hot chocolate I have ever had and it's vegan which I'm not. The service is top notch as well.  Off the beaten path and super chill.
author: Jeff S.

description: Wow what an experience! I of course already knew the Newtree chocolates but I have to say they have pushed the concept pretty far in this cafe. I can only recommend their delicious and organic pesto & goat cheese sandwich. Wonderful fruit salad too. I'm already back tomorrow.
author: Sebastien D.

description: Got the salad, but they did not have any dressing. Just a bottle of olive oil from Safeway. Paid $12 for a chicken salad, no dressing, wilted greens. At best - a glorified gift shop. Avoid.
author: Abraham Y.

description: I really like this place! It has a great atmosphere and very friendly staff! My new favorite things on the menu are the chicken verde sandwich and chicken-avocado salad (hmmmmm soooo good)!
author: Vasilisa R.

description:
Happened upon New Tree when I was searching for lunch in the area. REALLY pleasantly surprised.

First of all, they offer almond milk. As a person who is boy soy allergic and lactose intolerant, this is hugely appreciated. The Dirty Chai Latte is exactly what I need! I eventually want to try the Hot Chocolate, too.

Second, I'm obsessed with their Spinach Hummus roll. I've had it both times I've gone and I crave it. It is curried and has cranberries in it...yummy tastes and it's pretty big- and at $6 it's a really good lunch.

Haven't tried any of their other sandwiches, but I did have a soup that i was so/so on. Their pastries look really good, too.

Servers are perfectly nice, but occasionally aloof? Or maybe just soft spoken and me as a loudmouth think it's aloof. Anyway, they're very very nice and welcoming, regardless.
author: Ashley C.

description: I've stopped in at NewTree for a few drinks now; the first time I was lukewarm about the place but loved their assortment of chocolates (and free samples!).  The second time I visited here, I asked for one of their iced coffees.  They said they were out of their iced coffee but offered me an iced Americano.  Not usually an Americano person, I sort of just went with it and didn't know what to expect.  I was informed after 5 minutes that it was going to be awhile since one of their espresso machines had just broken down.  After another 5 minutes with no coffee, the cashier offered me two of their biscotti out on display as a thank you for waiting.  I was really taken by surprise with the gesture, and can always be appreciative of when businesses are sensitive to their customers.  Anyway, I wasn't going to write a review for them the first time, but having had such a positive experience there again, I wanted to put out there that NewTree's customer service was commendable.
author: Lisa I.

description: I work in a building next to NewTree part of the week, and when I'm in the office, NewTree is one of my best bets for lunch. Their soups in particular are excellent--especially the carrot coriander and the carrot ginger--smooth, fresh, and subtly flavored. Incidentally, these soups are also served with a delicious French roll.
author: Madeline S.

description: Several vegan options and adequate seating off a quiet street.
author: Johnny F.

description: Seriously....$9.95 for a small green salad, with cabbage, cranberries, oranges slices, and carrots..NO PROTEIN!  Do we just NOT care anymore that we will sit here and pay almost $10 for a tiny salad that has like 5 ingredients with no protein.  We have all lost it living here in SF!  Sad day when all the reviews here are soooo happy that they are getting ripped off.
author: rin c.

description: This place is simply amazing. Great , huge chocolate selection as well as all kinds of organic salads , soups and sandwiches. Hot chocolate is out of this world.
author: Lisa M.

description:
rude service. waiting in line - when arrived at the cash register about to order - gentleman behind the counter immediately turned his back to me  to mention to his co-worker gathering the trash that there are better trash bags. no acknowledgement or excuse that he would be right back. gentleman was working Wednesday 12/17 at 2:11pm. 

this is too bad as I've been to the shop many times previously and have received acknowledgment from previous staff. even cheerful.
author: Ebx X.

description: This place is overly priced and not worth it. I got a tiny quinoa salad that was dry, and a fancy beverage for $15! Still hungry and most likely won't be going back.
author: Hadeel M.

description: What a great addition to the area!   I love hot chocolate, and the almond hot chocolate hit the spot - very rich.   They may want to offer a smaller size because I was only able to consume half of it...   holy chocolate coma.   Love that they have gluten free brownies as well!
author: Cheryl B.

description: I think the food is pretty good.  I love having vegan soup options and the bread is fresh!  My only gripe is that these people are never ready at lunch time.  Their food arrives from a separate caterer and they clearly do not set up till well after 11:30am.  They don't seem to get that lunch hour starts early in SF around 11:15.  And they operate at a slow pace so be prepared to wait a little and slow down.
author: K L.

description: Normally I look the other way at pricing and portion sizes because hey, it's SF, but this time the flavor was mediocre and ordinary.  Nothing is made at time of order either so it could be fresher.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Love the chocolates here, like the Mocha and Coffee. I go to a few places in the fidi, this is a nice spot for when I want something a little different. Have also tried a chicken salad sandwich (the pomegranate in it was interesting)...it was pre-made but it was still good in a hurry (the place was full or else I might have eaten it there). I think the team here is very nice, had a good experience with Sophie. It's very pretty and I like their concept. Plus very convenient since I work right near there.
author: Theresa G.

description: Overpriced! I like the Mediterranean Cous Cous Salad but for the size of it, its still double what I want to spend on lunch. Only three weird flavored salad dressing offered and they are always out of balsamic. Sub-par.
author: Elle S.

description: Fresh, healthy, delicious, and quick! What else could you ask for on a lunch break? I had the quinoa salad. Perfect-o.
author: Diana S.

description: FINALLY!!!! They got a new barista!!!! There is really something about a good cappuccino with a good barista- they just know how to create the perfect thick milk. All the others- it is always too light and airy and run of the mill- your starbucks standard. But was I in shock today when not only did I get a cute design in the foam, but it was made properly. AND I have been going here for months. LOVE that everything is organic. The food is good, made daily, even though it's not made there and the chocolate is great. But overall, I come because the food is organic and I appreciate spending an extra dollar to not eat/drink pesticides. BUT to get a REALLY amazing cappuccino there? I am now in heaven....they can finally compete with the Blue Bottles of the world....
author: David B.

description: It is FABULOUS! I love the canopy, quinoa salad and superfruit chocolate.
author: Jeannie W.

description: Worst salad ever. The vegetables were old and tasted like it had been sitting for a long time in the fridge. inedible and at $10.45 it was a waste of my money. Avoid at all  costs.
author: Alfonso C.

description: Great coffee, hot chocolate and mocha all made with almond milk - so yummy! And fantastic chocolate bars in a wide variety of flavors including many vegan options. Recommend you try a few nibbles before buying, my favorites including dark chocolate with cherries and the quinoa/flax seed dark chocolate.
author: Kat L.

description: Great chai (available with almond milk!), great sweets, and great food. And at reasonable prices! Love that everything is organic, local, and/or fairly traded. This was my first trip, but I'll be back for sure.
author: Adam K.

description: I love the store overall, Newtree has amazing salads. I will come back for sure.
author: Andrew J.

description: They have added some things that are gluten/sugar-free friendly! Little bags of roasted almonds, etc. Maybe there's a fruit and cheese plate in the future? In either case, happy to say Yay! I'm a fan.
author: A P.

description: Pleasant interior space, with soft seating, nice staff, lots of vegan chocolates plus almond milk hot chocolate.  Will be exploring getting vegan baked goods as well, per staff.  Almond milk or soy are options for lattes.
author: Bob G.

description: Great food and chocolate. Big plus for Vegan hot chocolate & mocha. For those of us who are Vegan and allergic to Soy Milk they have Almond Milk Lattes! One of the few places in the city that do. Only criticism, while the service is fine it's rather annoying to listen to the staff bicker with each other.
author: Jeff D.

description: I discovered a green paradise in the city. It's just the perfect place for an healthy lunch or tasty pause a few blocks away from work. I knew New Tree delicious chocolate from Whole Foods and now they just opened their first coffee. This place is awesome, every detail counts, from the mirrors to the bamboos in the ceilings. I recommend their fruity salad and their chocolate mousse...irresistible! I also loved the way you can taste each of their chocolate. A new place not to be missed. You'll absolutely love it!
author: Camille C.

description: this place is close to work and a great place for a quick, healthy lunch.
author: BenHur C.
